messages.message:
re UAT testing. It seems that sharing ACLs are not working properly (if I haven't missed any hidden dependencies).
Particularly it seems that a user from one org can access an app shared by a link created by a user from another org.
I created an app by <mailto:support-testing+aihubuat-orgadmin@instabase.com|support-testing+aihubuat-orgadmin@instabase.com> - instabase UAT org
and can access it by <mailto:aihub.admin.email+instabase@instabase.com|aihub.admin.email+instabase@instabase.com> - UAT instabase org

Is that because the second one is an "admin"?

<mailto:aihub.admin.email+instabase@instabase.com|aihub.admin.email+instabase@instabase.com> is a site admin

site admins in Instabase are basically superadmins who can access everything

so this is expected!

Thanks!

(is there any way to understand that user is a superadmin other than guessing by the username? :wink: )
One thing you can do is try to access endpoints which are accessible by site admins only: e.g. `/apps/audit-logs` , `/apps/aihub-admin`

another way to check (this is what i usually do):
• open the browser console
• type `context` and press enter
• check whether `is_admin` is true
